HEADLINE: Bitcoin-Backed Loans: Unlocking a Revolutionary Era for Institutional Finance
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin-Backed Loans: Unlocking a Revolutionary Era for Institutional Finance Imagine a world where your digital assets, specifically your Bitcoin, can unlock significant traditional capital without needing to sell them. This isn‚Äôt a futuristic dream; it‚Äôs rapidly becoming a reality, spearheaded by major players in the crypto space. The latest buzz centers around Twenty One Capital, a firm already making waves with its substantial Bitcoin holdings, now exploring the groundbreaking potential of Bitcoin-backed loans . This strategic move could redefine how institutions leverage their crypto assets, bridging the gap between the burgeoning digital economy and established financial systems. Who is Twenty One Capital and Why Do They Matter in the Realm of Bitcoin-Backed Loans ? Twenty One Capital isn‚Äôt just another name in the crypto sphere; it‚Äôs a formidable entity with significant backing and an impressive digital asset portfolio. The firm boasts support from industry giants like Tether, the issuer of the world‚Äôs largest stablecoin, USDT, and Cantor Fitzgerald, a venerable Wall Street financial services firm. This powerful alliance lends immense credibility and institutional heft to Twenty One Capital‚Äôs endeavors. With a staggering holding of approximately 43,500 BTC, valued at over $5 billion, Twenty One Capital is positioning itself among the largest institutional Bitcoin holders globally. This substantial treasury of Bitcoin isn‚Äôt just sitting idle; it represents a significant pool of potential collateral, making the firm a pivotal player in the emerging market for Bitcoin-backed loans . Their exploration into this innovative financial product signals a growing trend: institutions are not just accumulating Bitcoin; they are actively seeking sophisticated ways to utilize it beyond mere speculation. By considering dollar loans secured by their massive Bitcoin reserves, Twenty One Capital is not only optimizing its own capital structure but also setting a precedent for how other large entities might manage and leverage their digital assets in the future. What Exactly Are Bitcoin-Backed Loans and How Do They Work? At its core, a Bitcoin-backed loan is a financial instrument that allows individuals or institutions to borrow fiat currency (like USD) or stablecoins by pledging their Bitcoin as collateral. Think of it like taking out a mortgage on your house, but instead of real estate, your digital gold is securing the loan. The beauty of this mechanism lies in its ability to provide liquidity without forcing the borrower to sell their Bitcoin, thus allowing them to retain ownership and potential future appreciation of their digital asset. Key Mechanics of a Bitcoin-Backed Loan : Collateral Pledging: The borrower transfers a specified amount of Bitcoin to a lender or a smart contract (in a decentralized setup) as collateral. This collateral acts as security for the loan. Loan Disbursement: The lender provides the agreed-upon loan amount in fiat currency or stablecoins. The loan-to-value (LTV) ratio typically ranges from 30% to 70%, meaning you can borrow 30-70% of your Bitcoin‚Äôs value, depending on the lender and market conditions. Interest and Repayment: The borrower pays interest on the loan over a defined period, similar to traditional loans. Once the loan, plus interest, is fully repaid, the Bitcoin collateral is released and returned to the borrower. Price Volatility Management: This is crucial due to Bitcoin‚Äôs inherent price volatility. Loans often include margin call thresholds. If the value of the pledged Bitcoin drops below a certain LTV, the borrower may be required to add more collateral (a ‚Äòmargin call‚Äô) or repay a portion of the loan to prevent the collateral from being liquidated. This financial innovation offers a compelling alternative for those who believe in Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value but require immediate access to capital for various purposes, from business operations to strategic investments, without divesting their crypto holdings. The Strategic Imperative: Why are Bitcoin-Backed Loans Gaining Traction Now? The increasing interest in Bitcoin-backed loans isn‚Äôt coincidental; it‚Äôs a reflection of the evolving crypto landscape and the growing sophistication of institutional players. Several factors contribute to this rising trend: Maturing Market: The cryptocurrency market has matured significantly beyond its early speculative days. With established infrastructure, clearer regulatory discussions, and a growing understanding of digital assets, institutions are more comfortable exploring complex financial products. Demand for Capital Efficiency: Large institutional holders of Bitcoin, like Twenty One Capital, often have significant capital tied up in their digital assets. text: Bitcoin-Backed Loans: Unlocking a Revolutionary Era for Institutional Finance. BitcoinWorld Bitcoin-Backed Loans: Unlocking a Revolutionary Era for Institutional Finance Imagine a world where your digital assets, specifically your Bitcoin, can unlock significant traditional capital without needing to sell them. This isn‚Äôt a futuristic dream; it‚Äôs rapidly becoming a reality, spearheaded by major players in the crypto space. The latest buzz centers around Twenty One Capital, a firm already making waves with its substantial Bitcoin holdings, now exploring the groundbreaking potential of Bitcoin-backed loans . This strategic move could redefine how institutions leverage their crypto assets, bridging the gap between the burgeoning digital economy and established financial systems. Who is Twenty One Capital and Why Do They Matter in the Realm of Bitcoin-Backed Loans ? Twenty One Capital isn‚Äôt just another name in the crypto sphere; it‚Äôs a formidable entity with significant backing and an impressive digital asset portfolio. The firm boasts support from industry giants like Tether, the issuer of the world‚Äôs largest stablecoin, USDT, and Cantor Fitzgerald, a venerable Wall Street financial services firm. This powerful alliance lends immense credibility and institutional heft to Twenty One Capital‚Äôs endeavors. With a staggering holding of approximately 43,500 BTC, valued at over $5 billion, Twenty One Capital is positioning itself among the largest institutional Bitcoin holders globally. This substantial treasury of Bitcoin isn‚Äôt just sitting idle; it represents a significant pool of potential collateral, making the firm a pivotal player in the emerging market for Bitcoin-backed loans . Their exploration into this innovative financial product signals a growing trend: institutions are not just accumulating Bitcoin; they are actively seeking sophisticated ways to utilize it beyond mere speculation. By considering dollar loans secured by their massive Bitcoin reserves, Twenty One Capital is not only optimizing its own capital structure but also setting a precedent for how other large entities might manage and leverage their digital assets in the future. What Exactly Are Bitcoin-Backed Loans and How Do They Work? At its core, a Bitcoin-backed loan is a financial instrument that allows individuals or institutions to borrow fiat currency (like USD) or stablecoins by pledging their Bitcoin as collateral. Think of it like taking out a mortgage on your house, but instead of real estate, your digital gold is securing the loan. The beauty of this mechanism lies in its ability to provide liquidity without forcing the borrower to sell their Bitcoin, thus allowing them to retain ownership and potential future appreciation of their digital asset. Key Mechanics of a Bitcoin-Backed Loan : Collateral Pledging: The borrower transfers a specified amount of Bitcoin to a lender or a smart contract (in a decentralized setup) as collateral. This collateral acts as security for the loan. Loan Disbursement: The lender provides the agreed-upon loan amount in fiat currency or stablecoins. The loan-to-value (LTV) ratio typically ranges from 30% to 70%, meaning you can borrow 30-70% of your Bitcoin‚Äôs value, depending on the lender and market conditions. Interest and Repayment: The borrower pays interest on the loan over a defined period, similar to traditional loans. Once the loan, plus interest, is fully repaid, the Bitcoin collateral is released and returned to the borrower. Price Volatility Management: This is crucial due to Bitcoin‚Äôs inherent price volatility. Loans often include margin call thresholds. If the value of the pledged Bitcoin drops below a certain LTV, the borrower may be required to add more collateral (a ‚Äòmargin call‚Äô) or repay a portion of the loan to prevent the collateral from being liquidated. This financial innovation offers a compelling alternative for those who believe in Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value but require immediate access to capital for various purposes, from business operations to strategic investments, without divesting their crypto holdings. The Strategic Imperative: Why are Bitcoin-Backed Loans Gaining Traction Now? The increasing interest in Bitcoin-backed loans isn‚Äôt coincidental; it‚Äôs a reflection of the evolving crypto landscape and the growing sophistication of institutional players. Several factors contribute to this rising trend: Maturing Market: The cryptocurrency market has matured significantly beyond its early speculative days. With established infrastructure, clearer regulatory discussions, and a growing understanding of digital assets, institutions are more comfortable exploring complex financial products. Demand for Capital Efficiency: Large institutional holders of Bitcoin, like Twenty One Capital, often have significant capital tied up in their digital assets. They need ways to unlock this capital for operational expenses, new investments, or even share buybacks, without incurring capital gains taxes by selling their holdings. Bridging TradFi and DeFi: Bitcoin-backed loans r

HEADLINE: Bitcoin, real estate, and the long game: inside El√≠as Sacal‚Äôs vision for Murano
SUMMARY: For over 30 years, Murano Global Investments Plc (Nasdaq: MRNO) has stood as one of Mexico‚Äôs most prolific real estate developers, with a portfolio that spans luxury hotels, resort residences, and large-scale commercial projects. With over $2 billion in capitalization deployed, and partnerships with global brands like Hyatt and Accor, Murano‚Äôs track record is built on a rare combination of architectural permanence and capital discipline. At the center of that legacy is Elias Sacal ‚Äì Chairman, CEO, and the guiding force behind Murano‚Äôs evolution from regional player to publicly listed company. Now, Sacal is leading Murano into a new chapter, one that integrates Bitcoin into the company‚Äôs long-term balance sheet strategy. Earlier this year, Murano acquired its first 21 Bitcoin. The decision was understated by design, a reflection of Sacal‚Äôs long-held belief that capital, like architecture, should be patient and purpose-built. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve always focused on assets that endure,‚Äù Sacal says. ‚ÄúBitcoin, like real estate, is scarce, resilient, and built for the long term.‚Äù Murano‚Äôs digital asset strategy is supported by a $500 million Standby Equity Purchase Agreement with Yorkville, enabling the company to gradually increase its Bitcoin holdings over time. This capital is earmarked from real estate development profits and selective asset sales ‚Äì a model that prioritizes self-financing over debt and builds reserves without diluting shareholder value. But Sacal‚Äôs ambitions go beyond portfolio construction. Murano is actively exploring ways to incorporate Bitcoin into its operating businesses, including the potential for BTC-native hospitality offerings, integrated loyalty systems, and new experiences designed for digital asset holders. These initiatives aim to bridge physical infrastructure with emerging financial ecosystems ‚Äì not as marketing, but as meaningful value creation. That vision is consistent with Sacal‚Äôs broader approach. In the early 2000s, he helped pioneer the ‚ÄúSecond Home Living‚Äù model across Mexico‚Äôs resort markets, positioning Murano at the forefront of international capital inflows into coastal real estate. Under his leadership, the firm has expanded into Mexico City, Canc√∫n, Ixtapa, and Baja, with development projects that blend luxury, utility, and long-term value. Today, Murano manages over $1 billion in appraised assets, has constructed more than 1,400 hotel rooms, and holds management agreements with several of the world‚Äôs top-tier hospitality operators. Continuity guides every decision, be it architectural or financial. ‚ÄúVision has always been at the core of what we do,‚Äù Sacal notes. ‚ÄúWhether we‚Äôre designing a hotel or allocating capital, the question is always the same‚Äîwill this create value ten, twenty, or fifty years from now?‚Äù As capital markets evolve and Bitcoin matures as an institutional-grade asset, Sacal is positioning Murano to meet the future with both feet on the ground and eyes firmly on the horizon. He‚Äôs not rejecting traditional finance, but augmenting it. Not shifting strategies, but extending them. Murano‚Äôs direction is clear: real assets on the ground, digital assets on the balance sheet. And under Sacal‚Äôs leadership, it is becoming a model for how legacy institutions can evolve with clarity, discipline, and conviction ‚Äî not by chasing trends, but by quietly setting the standard. The post Bitcoin, real estate, and the long game: inside El√≠as Sacal‚Äôs vision for Murano appeared first on Invezz

HEADLINE: U.S. Stock Market Soars: What This Stellar Opening Means for Your Investments
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld U.S. Stock Market Soars: What This Stellar Opening Means for Your Investments In the dynamic world of finance, where every tick of the clock can signal significant shifts, today‚Äôs opening bell brought exciting news for investors. The U.S. stock market has kicked off the day with a robust ascent, signaling a positive sentiment that could ripple far beyond traditional equities. For those deeply entrenched in the cryptocurrency space, understanding these movements in the broader financial landscape is crucial. After all, the lines between traditional finance and digital assets are blurring, and what happens in one often influences the other. Today‚Äôs Stellar U.S. Stock Market Performance As the trading day commenced, major indices across the U.S. stock market registered notable gains, painting a picture of optimism among investors. This initial upward momentum suggests a prevailing ‚Äòrisk-on‚Äô sentiment, where market participants are more willing to embrace assets with higher potential returns, often a good sign for growth-oriented sectors and, by extension, the often-volatile crypto market. Here‚Äôs a quick look at how the key indices performed at the open: Index Opening Performance What It Represents S&P 500 +0.10% A broad gauge of the U.S. economy, representing 500 large U.S. companies. NASDAQ Composite +0.20% Heavily weighted towards technology and growth companies. Dow Jones Industrial Average +0.03% A price-weighted average of 30 significant stocks traded on the NASDAQ and NYSE. The modest yet positive gains across these benchmarks indicate a healthy start to the day, reflecting underlying confidence in corporate earnings, economic data, or perhaps expectations around monetary policy. While seemingly small percentages, these early movements often set the tone for the entire trading session and can provide clues about broader market sentiment. What‚Äôs Driving This Upward Momentum in the U.S. Stock Market? When the U.S. stock market opens higher, it‚Äôs rarely due to a single factor. Instead, it‚Äôs typically a confluence of economic indicators, corporate news, and investor psychology. Understanding these drivers can offer valuable insights into market behavior. Positive Economic Data: Recent releases of economic data, such as lower-than-expected inflation figures, robust job growth, or strong consumer spending reports, can instill confidence. These indicators suggest a resilient economy, which bodes well for corporate profits and, consequently, stock valuations. Strong Corporate Earnings: As companies report their quarterly results, better-than-anticipated earnings or optimistic forward guidance can significantly boost investor confidence. When a majority of major corporations exceed expectations, it creates a positive ripple effect across the entire market. Investor Sentiment: Market psychology plays a massive role. Positive news, whether economic or geopolitical, can lead to a surge in investor optimism, encouraging more buying activity. Conversely, fear or uncertainty can lead to selling pressure. Today‚Äôs open suggests a prevailing optimistic mood. Anticipation of Monetary Policy: Expectations regarding interest rates and central bank policies are always a key driver. If investors anticipate that central banks might ease monetary policy or maintain favorable rates, it can make equities more attractive compared to bonds, driving capital into the stock market. These elements collectively contribute to the market‚Äôs initial direction. A positive open often reflects a belief that the economic environment is conducive to corporate growth and investment returns, which is a foundational element for any thriving market. How Do U.S. Stock Market Trends Ripple Through the Crypto World? For cryptocurrency enthusiasts, the performance of the U.S. stock market isn‚Äôt just background noise; it‚Äôs a crucial indicator. Historically, there‚Äôs been a noticeable correlation, especially between tech-heavy indices like the NASDAQ and major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. Here‚Äôs why this interconnectedness matters: Risk-On/Risk-Off Dynamics: When the traditional stock market is in a ‚Äòrisk-on‚Äô mood, meaning investors are seeking higher returns and are willing to take on more risk, this sentiment often spills over into the crypto market. Cryptocurrencies, particularly Bitcoin, are often seen as ‚Äòrisk assets‚Äô by institutional investors. If capital flows into equities, it often flows into crypto as well. Institutional Investment: A strong stock market encourages institutional investors to allocate more capital across various asset classes. As crypto adoption grows among these large players, a healthy traditional market environment can lead to increased institutional interest and investment in digital assets. Investor Confidence: A rising tide lifts all boats. When the overall financial market feels stable and growth-oriented, individual investors may feel more confident in diversifying their portfolios to include hig

HEADLINE: Analyst Starts VeChain (VET) Accumulation Based on This Bullish Signal
SUMMARY: CrediBULL Crypto, a well-followed technical analyst, has begun accumulating VeChain (VET) as a ‚Äútill end of cycle‚Äù hold, based purely on chart structure. In a recent post on X, he explained that VET printed a clean five-wave impulse more than a year ago, and he now believes the subsequent corrective Wave 2 is nearing completion. If accurate, this sets the stage for an explosive Wave 3 move, often the most powerful leg in Elliott Wave theory. To support his conviction, CrediBULL compared the structure to Bitcoin‚Äôs historic $3K bottom, noting that the last time he observed such a clean impulse was just before BTC launched into its multi-year rally from those lows. Have begun building a position in $VET as a "till end of cycle" hold. Purely a technical play as we printed a clean impulse over a year ago and I believe based on current market context the subsequent Wave 2 should be coming to an end relatively soon. $BTC chart as a comparison‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/BefJ0mrtxP ‚Äî CrediBULL Crypto (@CredibleCrypto) July 29, 2025 VET Price Overview and Market Snapshot As of report time, VeChain (VET) is trading at $0.02410, down roughly 4.5% over the past 24 hours. The token is also down nearly 10% on the weekly chart. VET‚Äôs market cap stands at approximately $2.07 billion, with a circulating supply of about 86 billion tokens and a maximum supply of 86.71 billion. Daily trading volume fluctuates between $60 million and $70 million, showing modest but consistent market activity. Technical indicators currently paint a bearish short-term picture. VET is rated as a ‚ÄúStrong Sell‚Äù across most metrics. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is hovering near 34, suggesting oversold conditions, while moving averages and momentum indicators continue to flash red. However, these technical weaknesses may reinforce CrediBULL‚Äôs thesis that Wave 2 is ending and VET could be preparing for a reversal. Wave Theory Outlook: Correction Nears Completion Recent Elliott Wave analysis on FXStreet aligns with CrediBULL‚Äôs view. It shows that VeChain is nearing the end of a complex double-corrective pattern, known as Wave II. Analysts project the final drop could touch the $0.020‚Äì$0.018 region before a potential breakout. If the price falls below $0.017, however, the wave count would be invalidated. The original impulse was notably clean, which is key in Elliott Wave setups. With corrective waves typically marked by overlapping and choppy movement, the current formation suggests the worst of the retracement may be behind. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Tactical Positioning and Risk Consideration CrediBULL emphasizes that this is a purely technical play, not based on VeChain‚Äôs enterprise partnerships or fundamentals. He‚Äôs positioning VET as a swing hold through the remainder of the cycle, with the expectation that a completed correction will ignite Wave 3, a leg typically marked by aggressive upside and sustained buying pressure. That said, risk management is crucial. A drop below the $0.017 level would invalidate the setup. Traders watching this play may look for bullish reversal signals like RSI divergence, volume spikes, or a clear five-wave recovery to confirm the start of a new uptrend. VET Poised for Next Leg? CrediBULL Crypto‚Äôs decision to start accumulating VET reflects confidence in a textbook Elliott Wave setup. With price sitting near $0.024 and signs pointing toward a completed correction, V ET may be approaching the launchpad for its next major move. If Wave 3 begins soon, this quiet accumulation phase could lead to substantial upside in the weeks and months ahead. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. HEADLINE: Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase Signals Market Sits Between Accumulation And Distribution
SUMMARY: Bitcoin remains trapped in a tight consolidation range that began over two weeks ago, fueling expectations of an imminent breakout or breakdown. The lack of decisive movement has created a state of market indecision, with neither bulls nor bears taking full control. Price continues to hover between key support and resistance levels, showing no strong signs of accumulation or distribution. Related Reading: Bitcoin Long-Term Holders Begin Distribution: Mirroring Fall 2024 Cycle According to new data from CryptoQuant, the Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase‚Äîa metric that reflects the overall temperature of the market‚Äîcurrently sits at a neutral level. This indicates that market conditions are balanced, with no clear dominance from buyers or sellers. Profit-taking remains moderate, ETF inflows have slowed, and long-term holder activity is stable, all of which support the view that the market is in a wait-and-see mode. The current structure suggests that a major move is likely approaching. With volatility compressed and the market treading water, traders and investors are closely watching for a signal that will define the next leg. Whether Bitcoin breaks out toward new highs or rolls over into a correction, the coming days will be crucial in shaping the short-term trend and broader sentiment across the crypto landscape. Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase Signals Neutral Market Top analyst Axel Adler recently shared insights into the Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase‚Äîa metric that condenses several key market indicators into a single scalar value, offering a simplified yet powerful view of where Bitcoin stands in its broader macro cycle. The metric combines data points such as overvaluation assessments, profit-taking activity, long-term holder (LTH) selling pressure, and ETF inflows to gauge whether the market is overheated or entering a favorable accumulation zone. When the Heat Macro Phase reaches high values near 50%, it typically signals that these components are at their upper historical bounds‚Äîsuggesting an overheated market that may be nearing a distribution phase or a correction. Conversely, readings closer to 30% reflect cooler market conditions: lower profit-taking, modest ETF activity, and minimal LTH selling. These scenarios often indicate that the market is undervalued and ripe for accumulation. Currently, the Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase sits at 44%, putting it squarely in the neutral zone. Adler explains that this level reflects a balanced market environment‚Äîneither overbought nor undervalued. There‚Äôs no clear dominance by bulls or bears. Profit-taking is beginning to accelerate, but it hasn‚Äôt reached a level that would suggest a broader exit is underway. This mid-range reading aligns with Bitcoin‚Äôs recent price action, which has remained in a tight consolidation for over two weeks. As the metric hovers in neutral territory, it reinforces the idea that the next significant move‚Äîwhether upward toward new highs or downward in a correction‚Äîwill depend entirely on upcoming price behavior. For now, the Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase acts as a market barometer, signaling patience as investors wait for the next breakout or breakdown to confirm direction. text: Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase Signals Market Sits Between Accumulation And Distribution. Bitcoin remains trapped in a tight consolidation range that began over two weeks ago, fueling expectations of an imminent breakout or breakdown. The lack of decisive movement has created a state of market indecision, with neither bulls nor bears taking full control. Price continues to hover between key support and resistance levels, showing no strong signs of accumulation or distribution. Related Reading: Bitcoin Long-Term Holders Begin Distribution: Mirroring Fall 2024 Cycle According to new data from CryptoQuant, the Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase‚Äîa metric that reflects the overall temperature of the market‚Äîcurrently sits at a neutral level. This indicates that market conditions are balanced, with no clear dominance from buyers or sellers. Profit-taking remains moderate, ETF inflows have slowed, and long-term holder activity is stable, all of which support the view that the market is in a wait-and-see mode. The current structure suggests that a major move is likely approaching. With volatility compressed and the market treading water, traders and investors are closely watching for a signal that will define the next leg. Whether Bitcoin breaks out toward new highs or rolls over into a correction, the coming days will be crucial in shaping the short-term trend and broader sentiment across the crypto landscape. Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase Signals Neutral Market Top analyst Axel Adler recently shared insights into the Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase‚Äîa metric that condenses several key market indicators into a single scalar value, offering a simplified yet powerful view of where Bitcoin stands in its broader macro cycle. The metric combines data points such as overvaluation assessments, profit-taking activity, long-term holder (LTH) selling pressure, and ETF inflows to gauge whether the market is overheated or entering a favorable accumulation zone. When the Heat Macro Phase reaches high values near 50%, it typically signals that these components are at their upper historical bounds‚Äîsuggesting an overheated market that may be nearing a distribution phase or a correction. Conversely, readings closer to 30% reflect cooler market conditions: lower profit-taking, modest ETF activity, and minimal LTH selling. These scenarios often indicate that the market is undervalued and ripe for accumulation. Currently, the Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase sits at 44%, putting it squarely in the neutral zone. Adler explains that this level reflects a balanced market environment‚Äîneither overbought nor undervalued. There‚Äôs no clear dominance by bulls or bears. Profit-taking is beginning to accelerate, but it hasn‚Äôt reached a level that would suggest a broader exit is underway. This mid-range reading aligns with Bitcoin‚Äôs recent price action, which has remained in a tight consolidation for over two weeks. As the metric hovers in neutral territory, it reinforces the idea that the next significant move‚Äîwhether upward toward new highs or downward in a correction‚Äîwill depend entirely on upcoming price behavior. For now, the Bitcoin Heat Macro Phase acts as a market barometer, signaling patience as investors wait for the next breakout or breakdown to confirm direction. HEADLINE: Ethereum at 10: What''s Next for the World Computer?
SUMMARY: When Ethereum launched on July 30, 2015, it set out to be more than just another cryptocurrency. It aimed to expand the boundaries of blockchain technology itself. While Bitcoin became digital gold, Ethereum pursued a more expansive vision: to be a decentralized ‚ÄúWorld Computer‚Äù‚Äîprogrammable, extensible, and open-ended. A decade later, Ethereum has transformed finance, culture and software. Along the way, it has faced existential crises, volatile markets and fierce internal debates. Now, it stands on the cusp of a new era‚Äîone that may see it fully embraced by traditional finance. Ethereum has seen an uptick in the last two months as the project hits the 10 year milestone, with its ETH‚Äôs price rebounded, reaching $3,800 in July , after it languished around $1500 just in April. Over the last few months, the ecosystem has seen a new wave of use cases including tokenization and stablecoin growth, and the network also benefited from the trend of companies holding ETH in their treasuries, not just for long-term value, but to earn yield. The Whitepaper That Started It All Ethereum was born from a whitepaper penned by then-19-year-old Vitalik Buterin in 2014, a Canadian college dropout and passionate Bitcoin enthusiast who, inspired by the limitations he saw in Bitcoin, envisioned a more versatile blockchain platform. The network went live a year later, backed by the newly formed Ethereum Foundation (EF), which was tasked with supporting development and spreading Ethereum‚Äôs mission. But Ethereum‚Äôs honeymoon phase didn‚Äôt last. In 2016, the now-infamous DAO Hack nearly broke the network apart when a smart contract vulnerability allowed an attacker to siphon off over 3.6 million ETH, about $13.5 billion at today‚Äôs prices. To undo the damage, Ethereum executed a controversial hard fork, effectively creating a new version blockchain. At the time, many saw that the decision to splinter it off broke with the foundational blockchain principle that transactions are immutable and the system is permissionless, raising concerns that human intervention could undermine trust in the protocol''s neutrality. After the split, the original chain continued on as Ethereum Classic. ‚ÄúWe showed that we made the right decision, instead of letting the attacker keep all of that ether back then, and that would have been a burden on us this entire time, with trying to get adoption and [focus on building] different things,‚Äù said Hudson Jameson, the former Protocol Community Lead at the Ethereum Foundation, in an interview with CoinDesk. The ICO Boom and the Road to the Merge Following the DAO episode, Ethereum entered a period of explosive growth. The 2017 ICO boom saw startups raise billions using ERC-20 tokens. DeFi protocols like MakerDAO, Compound, and Uniswap emerged, enabling permissionless lending, borrowing and trading. But Ethereum‚Äôs success exposed its weaknesses. Network congestion and high gas fees revealed a dire need for scalability. Developers began work on Ethereum‚Äôs most ambitious upgrade: transitioning from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake in what would become known as the Merge. The effort, which began in 2017, culminated on September 15, 2022. The transition reduced Ethereum‚Äôs energy consumption by over 90% and opened the door to staking. At the same time, layer-2 rollups like Arbitrum, Optimism, and zkSync began to take shape. These networks offered faster, cheaper transactions while leveraging Ethereum‚Äôs security. ‚ÄúThe moment when we realized that layer-2s were really taking off and we started to see L2 transaction volumes equal or exceed those of the mainnet and at much, much lower costs,‚Äù was a turning point, said Paul Brody, global blockchain leader at EY. Today, layer-2 solutions are bringing in major players. Robinhood announced it will build its own rollup using Arbitrum tech, while Deutsche Bank plans to leverage ZKync for its blockchain initiatives. A Crisis at the Ethereum Foundation? After a grueling bear market in 2022‚Äì2023, crypto began to recover. Bitcoin surged past $100,000 . Solana, offering quicker transactions and lower fees, emerged as a viable competitor, attracting more new developers to its ecosystem than Ethereum , as well as capital and hype. Meanwhile, ether lagged, dropping to a four-year low against bitcoin in December 2024 , prompting concerns among some in the community about Ethereum‚Äôs future, and whether the EF was doing enough to steer the development in the right direction. As things started to bubble up into a crisis, core figures at the Foundation started to ask about where the ecosystem was heading. ‚ÄúHow do we ensure that it''s the best thing by many standards? How does it win? How does it be the thing that is adopted,‚Äù said Danny Ryan, former Ethereum Foundation core developer and Merge architect. Ryan now co-leads Etherealize, which helps institutions integrate with Ethereum. In February 2025, in response to mounting criticism, the EF restructured its leadership , appointing two new co-

HEADLINE: Altcoin Season May Have Finally Arrived Amid Institutional Interest and Clarity
SUMMARY: A long-awaited rotation from Bitcoin to the altcoin market could be in motion, as per Sygnum‚Äôs Q3 2025 Investment Outlook. The digital asset bank points to increased regulatory clarity, on-chain activity, and improved market liquidity as the catalysts behind this shift, hinting that the much-anticipated ‚Äúaltseason‚Äù may have finally begun. Earlier in the year, geopolitical uncertainty and concerns around U.S. fiscal stability had pushed investors toward Bitcoin, temporarily suppressing the altcoin market. But with regulatory bodies now offering clearer guidance‚Äîespecially regarding staking and token classification‚Äîaltcoins with strong fundamentals are seeing renewed interest. Bitcoin Dominance Fades Amid Altcoin Resurgence According to Sygnum, Bitcoin‚Äôs dominance recently fell by more than 6% after reaching its highest levels since 2021 . While Bitcoin remains in a strong position‚Äîdriven by high demand, limited supply, and over $160 billion now locked in spot ETFs‚Äîcapital appears to be flowing back into the altcoin market. Bitcoin‚Äôs recent all-time high above $123,000 was backed by surging institutional interest, including over 110,000 BTC accumulated by ETFs last quarter. Ether also displayed bullish signals, with falling balances on exchanges, increasing ETF inflows, and nearly 30% of its liquid supply staked. In particular, Ethereum has captured institutional attention following its successful Pectra upgrade, which raised staking limits and improved network performance. Sygnum noted that the SEC‚Äôs recent clarification that protocol staking does not violate securities laws further strengthened investor confidence in ETH. A wave of tokenization efforts from major financial institutions like BNY Mellon and Soci√©t√© G√©n√©rale, as well as political entities backing stablecoins like the USD1, are increasingly being built on Ethereum, reinforcing its position as a leader in the smart contract ecosystem. DEX and DeFi See Explosive Growth Decentralized exchanges (DEXs) captured 30% of crypto spot market share last quarter, setting a new record with over $530 billion in trading volume. This rise was fueled in part by the popularity of memecoin launches, particularly on platforms like PancakeSwap and Solana‚Äôs PumpSwap. The DeFi lending sector also reached new highs, with $70 billion in total value locked. Liquid staking now accounts for over 30% of all staked Ether, as investors continue to embrace higher risk and leverage. Still, Sygnum warned that altcoin enthusiasm‚Äîespecially around memecoins‚Äîcould risk creating another bubble, with a sharp correction likely if speculative momentum outpaces fundamentals. The post Altcoin Season May Have Finally Arrived Amid Institutional Interest and Clarity appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

HEADLINE: Bitcoin Reserve Asset: Canaan‚Äôs Bold Strategic Shift Towards Digital Gold
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Reserve Asset: Canaan‚Äôs Bold Strategic Shift Towards Digital Gold In a significant move that echoes through the corridors of both traditional finance and the burgeoning digital asset world, Canaan, a prominent Nasdaq-listed Chinese mining equipment manufacturer and Bitcoin mining firm, has made a resounding declaration: Bitcoin is now its primary long-term reserve asset. This isn‚Äôt just a simple treasury adjustment; it‚Äôs a powerful statement, cementing Bitcoin‚Äôs growing legitimacy as a core financial holding for public companies. With 1,484 BTC, valued at approximately $74 million, now firmly on its balance sheet, Canaan is not only selling the picks and shovels of the crypto gold rush but also strategically accumulating the digital gold itself. This strategic pivot marks a crucial milestone, aligning Canaan‚Äôs financial destiny even more closely with the broader Bitcoin ecosystem and reinforcing the narrative of Bitcoin as a formidable Bitcoin reserve asset . Why Embrace a Bitcoin Reserve Asset Strategy? Why are more and more companies, especially those deeply embedded in the blockchain industry, choosing to hold Bitcoin as a significant part of their treasury? The rationale behind adopting a Bitcoin reserve asset strategy is multi-faceted and compelling. For decades, corporate treasuries have relied on traditional assets like cash, bonds, and equities. However, the current economic landscape, characterized by inflationary pressures and low interest rates, has prompted a re-evaluation of these conventional approaches. Bitcoin offers a compelling alternative for several reasons: Inflation Hedge: Often dubbed ‚Äòdigital gold,‚Äô Bitcoin‚Äôs finite supply (capped at 21 million coins) makes it a potent hedge against inflation, unlike fiat currencies which can be devalued by quantitative easing. Store of Value: Its decentralized nature and robust network security provide a reliable, censorship-resistant store of value, particularly attractive in an unpredictable global economy. Industry Alignment: For companies like Canaan, whose core business revolves around Bitcoin mining, holding BTC as a reserve asset creates a direct alignment of interests. Their success is intrinsically linked to Bitcoin‚Äôs success, fostering greater commitment and potentially enhancing investor confidence. Growth Potential: Despite its volatility, Bitcoin has historically demonstrated significant long-term growth potential, offering the possibility of substantial appreciation for corporate balance sheets. Companies like MicroStrategy have famously led the charge, accumulating vast amounts of Bitcoin, showcasing a bold vision for corporate treasury management in the digital age. Their conviction has inspired many others to consider the merits of a substantial Bitcoin reserve asset . Canaan‚Äôs Pivotal Move: A Deep Dive into their Bitcoin Reserve Asset Holdings Canaan‚Äôs decision to designate Bitcoin as its primary long-term reserve asset is a significant testament to the digital currency‚Äôs maturing status. According to Stock Titan, the company now holds 1,484 BTC, a substantial sum valued at around $74 million at the time of the announcement. This isn‚Äôt merely a speculative investment; it‚Äôs a foundational shift in their financial strategy. What does this mean for Canaan and its position in the market? Beyond Hardware: Canaan is traditionally known as a leading manufacturer of Bitcoin mining hardware, providing the essential infrastructure for the global mining industry. By holding such a significant Bitcoin reserve asset , they are effectively transforming into a hybrid entity ‚Äì not just a supplier, but also a direct participant and accumulator in the Bitcoin economy. Strategic Alignment: This move perfectly aligns their corporate treasury with their operational focus. As a Bitcoin mining firm, their profitability is tied to Bitcoin‚Äôs price and network health. By holding BTC, they mitigate some operational risks and capitalize directly on the asset they help secure and grow. Confidence in Bitcoin: The fact that a Nasdaq-listed, publicly traded company is making such a declaration sends a powerful signal to the market. It demonstrates a deep-seated confidence in Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term viability, stability, and potential as a legitimate financial asset, further solidifying the narrative of Bitcoin as a reliable Bitcoin reserve asset . This strategic accumulation positions Canaan not just as a technology provider but as a significant stakeholder in the future of decentralized finance. What are the Implications of Holding a Bitcoin Reserve Asset? While the benefits are clear, adopting a substantial Bitcoin reserve asset strategy also comes with its own set of implications and challenges that companies must carefully navigate. It‚Äôs a strategic decision that requires robust risk management and a clear understanding of the cryptocurrency landscape. Volatility Management: Bitcoin‚Äôs price volatility is well-known. Companies holding large am

HEADLINE: Bitcoin and Ethereum Market Update: Support, Institutional Flows & Dollar Risk
SUMMARY: The price of Bitcoin, the first cryptocurrency, is stuck in a range between support at $116,000 and resistance around $120,000. The Ethereum rate is also losing momentum as it approaches the psychological mark of $4,000. This was reported by analysts at QCP Capital. In their opinion, in the medium term there remains a high probability of reaching new all-time highs. This is facilitated by institutional capital inflows and positive changes in regulation. Analysts noted that companies like SharpLink Gaming continue to raise funds to buy Bitcoin and Ethereum, indicating long-term confidence in these assets. Total daily net inflows into the ETH ETF are $218.64 million. However, in the short term, experts urge caution. The market reacts weakly to positive news, including the adoption of crypto-friendly legislation in the US and progress in the ETF space. The lack of growth on the back of good news often signals market exhaustion and is classic late-cycle behavior, the experts emphasized. Threat from the dollar Analysts associate the main macroeconomic risk with the US dollar. Most traders are betting on its weakening by opening short positions. According to the CFTC, the number of such positions has reached extreme values. This situation leaves the market vulnerable to a short squeeze. If the dollar exchange rate starts to rise, traders will be forced to close unprofitable trades en masse. This could trigger a move away from risky assets, including cryptocurrencies, analysts explained. The focus will be on U.S. inflation and employment data in the coming days, which will determine the market''s development in the third quarter. At the July meeting, Fed analysts expect the key rate to remain unchanged. The regulator will most likely emphasize that its decisions depend on incoming data. The September meeting will be key, as the chances of a rate cut remain balanced. The majority (97.5%) of market participants expect the indicator to remain at the same level following the meeting on July 30. Bitcoin Falls to $110,000 Glassnode analysts have indicated a possible correction in Bitcoin to the $110,000 level to test key support. The reason could be a ‚Äùprice gap‚Äù without significant trading volume at this level. Experts explained that as the price rose rapidly from $110,000 to $115,000, investors had little time to buy, creating an area without strong support based on the asset purchase price. ‚ÄúThere remains an air pocket of volume between $115,000 and $110,000 below the current spot price. This is the result of the price moving through the range without any room for transactions,‚Äù the report said. Glassnode believes the market may test this zone in search of support. Although such gaps are not always filled, they create a ‚Äùpull‚Äù for the price. Analysts used the cost basis of short-term holders to identify potential support levels, which also help identify prices at which investors might begin to take profits. Using standard deviation, Glassnode predicted a possible local maximum of around $140,000 if growth resumes. ‚ÄúIf the market breaks higher, $141,000 is likely to be the next major resistance area where selling pressure could quickly intensify,‚Äù the firm concluded.

HEADLINE: Kraken Revenue: Remarkable Q2 Growth Unveiled Despite Investment Challenges
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Kraken Revenue: Remarkable Q2 Growth Unveiled Despite Investment Challenges In the dynamic world of cryptocurrency, where market shifts can be as swift as they are significant, understanding the financial performance of leading exchanges offers invaluable insights. Recently, major cryptocurrency exchange Kraken unveiled its second-quarter results, painting a compelling picture of growth and strategic investment. This deep dive will explore the latest figures, unpack the strategic decisions behind them, and offer a comprehensive view of Kraken‚Äôs journey in a constantly evolving digital asset landscape. Let‚Äôs explore the impressive figures behind Kraken Revenue. Kraken Revenue: A Deep Dive into Q2‚Äôs Financial Triumphs Kraken, a prominent player in the global cryptocurrency exchange arena, has reported a substantial uplift in its second-quarter revenue. According to JinSe Finance, citing Bloomberg, the exchange saw its revenue climb an impressive 18% year-over-year, reaching a robust $412 million . This significant increase underscores Kraken‚Äôs enduring appeal and operational strength in a competitive market. While the top-line revenue figure certainly stands out, a closer look at the underlying metrics reveals the pillars supporting this growth. Here‚Äôs a snapshot of Kraken‚Äôs Q2 performance: Total Revenue: $412 million (an 18% year-over-year increase) Adjusted Pre-Tax Profit: $79.7 million (a 7% decrease year-over-year) Trading Volume: $186.8 billion (a 19% increase year-over-year) Funded Accounts: 4.4 million (a 37% increase year-over-year) The impressive surge in Kraken Revenue, coupled with the growth in trading volume and funded accounts, signals a healthy expansion of its user base and increased engagement on its platform. These figures collectively highlight Kraken‚Äôs ability to attract and retain users, even as market conditions fluctuate. Navigating the Waters: Why Did Kraken‚Äôs Pre-Tax Profit Dip? Despite the stellar revenue growth, Kraken‚Äôs adjusted pre-tax profit experienced a slight dip, falling approximately 7% to $79.7 million. At first glance, this might seem counterintuitive when revenue is on the rise. However, the report clarifies that this decrease is a direct consequence of Kraken‚Äôs strategic investments. The exchange has been channeling significant resources into two key areas: New Product Development: Innovation is crucial in the fast-paced crypto industry. Kraken‚Äôs commitment to building and launching new products and features ensures it remains at the forefront of technological advancements and meets the evolving needs of its users. These investments often involve substantial research and development costs, as well as hiring specialized talent. Geographic Expansion: Broadening its global footprint is another strategic imperative for Kraken. Expanding into new markets requires significant upfront investment in legal and regulatory compliance, localized marketing efforts, and establishing operational infrastructure. While these investments can temporarily impact profitability, they are essential for long-term growth and market penetration. This strategic decision to prioritize long-term growth over immediate profit maximization is a common play for mature companies in high-growth sectors. It suggests that Kraken is confident in the future potential of the crypto market and its own position within it, choosing to build a stronger, more resilient foundation for sustained expansion. The investment in new products and geographic expansion is crucial for future Kraken Revenue streams. Unpacking the Surge: What Drove Kraken‚Äôs Trading Volume and User Growth? The impressive 19% increase in trading volume, reaching $186.8 billion, and the 37% surge in funded accounts to 4.4 million are not mere coincidences. They are indicative of several factors contributing to Kraken‚Äôs robust performance. What‚Äôs fueling this growth? Market Recovery and Sentiment: The second quarter saw a period of renewed optimism in the broader crypto market. As Bitcoin and other major cryptocurrencies experienced price stabilization or upward trends, investor confidence often returns, leading to increased trading activity. Kraken‚Äôs platform, known for its liquidity and security, is well-positioned to capitalize on such shifts in market sentiment. Platform Reliability and Security: In an industry plagued by security concerns and platform outages, Kraken has consistently emphasized its commitment to robust security measures and reliable uptime. This focus builds user trust, a critical factor in attracting and retaining traders. Diverse Product Offerings: While the report mentions investments in new products, Kraken already offers a wide array of services beyond spot trading, including staking, margin trading, and OTC services. This comprehensive suite caters to various types of investors, from beginners to institutional clients, enhancing user engagement and overall trading volume. Effective User Acquisition Strategie

HEADLINE: Bitcoin dubbed the ‚ÄòS&P 500 of the future‚Äô: here‚Äôs what it means
SUMMARY: 22V Research chief investment officer Jordi Visser says Bitcoin, the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency by market cap, is the ‚ÄúS&P 500 of the future.‚Äù With digital assets, including Ethereum, gaining traction, and the ‚ÄúGENIUS Act‚Äù becoming a law, Visser believes the current cycle marks a turning point in crypto‚Äôs mainstream adoption. Bitcoin has already surpassed its previous high and is now trading near $120,000, but according to Visser, who spoke in a recent interview with CNBC, the cryptocurrency still has substantial upside potential. What Bitcoin as the S&P 500 of the future means Visser‚Äôs comparison of Bitcoin to the S&P 500 isn‚Äôt just metaphorical ‚Äì it‚Äôs a strategic framing of Bitcoin as a foundational asset in a rapidly evolving financial landscape. As artificial intelligence (AI) disrupts traditional industries, Visser argues that BTC represents a resilient store of value outside the legacy financial system. He sees it as a hedge against systemic change, much like how the S&P 500 reflects the health of corporate America. In his view, Bitcoin will increasingly anchor portfolios in the years ahead, especially as stablecoins and digital assets become more integrated into everyday transactions. It‚Äôs not just a tech bet ‚Äì it‚Äôs a macro hedge. Bitcoin vs crypto-proxies: Visser picks a side According to Jordi Visser, choosing between buying Bitcoin or investing in crypto-proxies instead depends primarily on the investor‚Äôs risk tolerance. Those interested in chasing higher upside, albeit with more volatility, he recommends building a position in proxies like MicroStrategy Inc (NASDAQ: MSTR), the largest corporate holder of BTC . Personally, however, Visser favours direct exposure to Bitcoin as it‚Äôs a more stable and strategic long-term play. While companies like Bitmine Immersion or Bit Digital offer alternative routes to gain exposure to the crypto market, the 22V Research chief investment officer continues to see BTC as the most reliable asset in a world of accelerating technological disruption. Note that Bitcoin has materially outperformed the benchmark stock market indices this year, and is currently up well over 50% versus its year-to-date low in early April. Is it too late to invest in Bitcoin? Speaking with CNBC , Visser revealed the most common question he receives from traditional fiat investors is: ‚ÄúAm I too late‚Äù in building a position in the likes of Bitcoin? His answer is a resounding no. Visser believes many sceptics will eventually own BTC ‚Äì they just won‚Äôt admit it publicly. Drawing parallels to hidden voter behaviour in political polls, Visser argues the leading crypto‚Äôs growing legitimacy makes it harder to ignore. The 22V Research expert maintains a bold price target of $200K for Bitcoin this year, underscoring his belief in its long-term potential. As AI adoption accelerates and stablecoins become more prevalent, Visser sees Bitcoin as a necessary hedge in portfolios navigating an uncertain future. The post Bitcoin dubbed the ''S&P 500 of the future'': here''s what it means appeared first on Invezz

HEADLINE: Bitcoin Investment: Belgravia Hartford‚Äôs Strategic $5M Debenture Boosts Institutional Confidence
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Investment: Belgravia Hartford‚Äôs Strategic $5M Debenture Boosts Institutional Confidence The world of digital assets is constantly evolving, and institutional interest continues to be a major driving force. In a significant move that underscores growing confidence in the cryptocurrency market, Belgravia Hartford Capital, a publicly traded Canadian investment firm, has successfully secured a substantial $5 million convertible debenture specifically earmarked for a strategic Bitcoin investment . This development not only highlights the increasing mainstream adoption of digital currencies but also provides a fascinating glimpse into how traditional finance is finding innovative ways to engage with the crypto economy. Belgravia Hartford‚Äôs Bold Move: A Strategic Bitcoin Investment Belgravia Hartford Capital, known for its diversified investment portfolio, recently announced the closure of a C$5 million (approximately US$3.65 million at current exchange rates, though the article states $5 million directly for simplicity) convertible debenture. This significant capital injection comes from the Round13 Digital Asset Fund, a notable player in the digital asset space. The terms of the agreement are straightforward yet impactful: a 4% annual interest rate with a maturity period of two years. The primary objective? To acquire Bitcoin (BTC), directly integrating the world‚Äôs leading cryptocurrency into Belgravia Hartford‚Äôs asset holdings. This isn‚Äôt just another routine financial transaction; it‚Äôs a calculated decision by a public company to gain direct exposure to Bitcoin, signaling a deeper conviction in its long-term value proposition. For many years, institutional players have approached cryptocurrencies with caution. However, as the market matures and regulatory clarity slowly emerges, firms like Belgravia Hartford are demonstrating a willingness to commit significant capital, paving the way for broader institutional adoption. Understanding the Mechanics: What is a Convertible Debenture? The term ‚Äúconvertible debenture‚Äù might sound complex, but it‚Äôs a relatively common financial instrument that offers flexibility. In essence, it‚Äôs a type of loan issued by a company that can be converted into a specified number of shares of the issuing company‚Äôs common stock at the lender‚Äôs option. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of its key features in this context: Debt Component: Initially, it functions like a bond. Belgravia Hartford receives $5 million and agrees to pay 4% interest annually to Round13 Digital Asset Fund for two years. Convertibility Option: At maturity, or under certain conditions, Round13 has the option to convert the principal amount of the debenture into common shares of Belgravia Hartford Capital. This provides Round13 with potential upside if Belgravia Hartford‚Äôs stock performs well. Purpose: Crucially, the funds raised are explicitly designated for a Bitcoin investment . This transparency is vital for understanding the firm‚Äôs strategic intent. Benefit for Belgravia Hartford: It‚Äôs a way to raise capital without immediately diluting existing shareholders (if it‚Äôs converted, dilution occurs later) and often comes with lower interest rates than traditional loans, especially when tied to a specific growth opportunity like Bitcoin. Benefit for Round13: They get a fixed interest return, plus the potential to participate in the equity growth of Belgravia Hartford if their strategic Bitcoin investment pays off and boosts the company‚Äôs valuation. This structure showcases a sophisticated approach to financing a digital asset acquisition, blending traditional finance tools with the innovative world of crypto. Why Bitcoin Investment Now? The Institutional Imperative The decision by Belgravia Hartford to allocate substantial capital towards Bitcoin isn‚Äôt an isolated incident; it‚Äôs part of a broader trend of increasing institutional interest in the digital asset space. Several factors contribute to this growing imperative for a Bitcoin investment : Inflation Hedge: In an era of economic uncertainty and rising inflation concerns, Bitcoin is increasingly viewed by some as a digital store of value, akin to ‚Äúdigital gold,‚Äù offering a potential hedge against currency debasement. Scarcity and Supply Cap: Bitcoin‚Äôs fixed supply cap of 21 million coins makes it a deflationary asset, a stark contrast to fiat currencies that can be printed infinitely. This scarcity is a significant draw for long-term investors. Emerging Asset Class: As the cryptocurrency market matures, Bitcoin has established itself as a legitimate, albeit volatile, asset class that can offer diversification benefits within a broader investment portfolio. Growing Infrastructure: The development of robust custody solutions, regulated exchanges, and institutional-grade products has made it safer and more feasible for traditional firms to engage with Bitcoin. First-Mover Advantage: Firms that gain early exposure to Bitcoin, especially through strategic, well-

HEADLINE: Ex-Bridgewater CIO Warns Market‚Äôs Next Big Move Could Be Driven by Just a Handful of Executives ‚Äì Here‚Äôs Why
SUMMARY: A former executive at the hedge fund founded by billionaire Ray Dalio says she‚Äôs closely monitoring the sentiment of Corporate America‚Äôs top executives as earnings season picks up speed. In a new CNBC Television interview, ex-Bridgewater chief investment officer Rebecca Patterson says this earnings season will offer key insights into the trajectory of the US economy in the months ahead. Patterson says that while strong bank earnings reflect the health and sentiment of US consumers, she notes that it‚Äôs now time to keep a close eye on the outlook of America‚Äôs C-suite executives. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm watching more than anything else is the qualitative assessment by the executives of where we go from here. I don‚Äôt really care about the backward-looking. I want to know: are input costs going up yet? Are they investing more or less? Because their sentiment will drive corporate activity over the next six months, and that‚Äôs going to be a big factor for the broader macro view.‚Äù Patterson also believes that America will soon feel the brunt of Trump‚Äôs tariffs, as the forces that have helped to keep inflation in check begin to fade. ‚ÄúI think going forward, the inventories that had helped us have been wound down. Trans-shipments helped, and that‚Äôs something the government is going to get tough on. So I do think there‚Äôs a greater chance that we‚Äôre going to see more of the tariff impact come through on prices. And then it‚Äôs a question: how much does a consumer bear? How much do corporates absorb? We don‚Äôt know what that exact mix would be, but directionally, I think the risk is that we have higher inflation in the second half of this year. That means that two Fed cuts by January are at risk.‚Äù Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Don''t Miss a Beat ‚Äì Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. HEADLINE: ETH Perp Volume Crushes BTC for First Time Since 2022 ‚Äì Can BlackRock Buying Spree Push Ethereum Past $4,000?
SUMMARY: Ethereum (ETH) perpetual futures volume has surged ahead of Bitcoin (BTC) for the first time since the 2022 market cycle bottom, creating the most significant volume imbalance favoring ETH in recorded history. Data from Glassnode reveals that ETH global perpetual futures volume commanded the market with $90.82 billion, while Bitcoin trailed at $82.93 billion. #Ethereum perp volume dominance has recently overtaken #Bitcoin for the first time since the 2022 cycle low ‚Äì marking the largest volume skew in $ETH favor on record. This shift confirms a meaningful rotation of speculative interest toward the #altcoin sector. pic.twitter.com/Wm5bmPaaed ‚Äî glassnode (@glassnode) July 29, 2025 This development indicates a substantial shift in speculative attention toward the altcoin ecosystem, fueling widespread expectations that Ethereum could breach the $4,000 threshold imminently. BlackRock‚Äôs $1.2B Accumulation Spree Supports Ethereum to $4,000 Target The optimistic outlook has gained momentum through institutional capital flows, with BlackRock leading an unprecedented Ethereum acquisition campaign that saw the asset manager purchase over four times more ETH than BTC during the previous week. Between July 21 and 27, BlackRock acquired more than $1.2 billion worth of ETH, compared to just $267 million in Bitcoin purchases. BLACKROCK BOUGHT OVER 4X AS MUCH ETH VS BTC LAST WEEK BlackRock purchased over $1.2 BILLION of ETH last week, against only $267M of BTC. This is what it looks like when institutions allocate to ETH. pic.twitter.com/G7uh860hLR ‚Äî Arkham (@arkham) July 29, 2025 This institutional appetite has been reinforced by substantial accumulation from major players, including Tom Lee‚Äôs BitMine Immersion Technologies, Sharplink Gaming‚Äôs multi-billion-dollar Ethereum holdings , and ETH Strategy‚Äôs recent $46.5 million fundraising initiative to expand ETH token acquisitions. Most recently, World Liberty Financial, a cryptocurrency venture associated with U.S. President Donald Trump, maintained its aggressive Ethereum accumulation approach by purchasing an additional $1 million worth of ETH on July 29. Additionally, on July 30, Marti Technologies, a Turkish ride-hailing company, disclosed that 20% of its cash reserves are now allocated to digital assets , encompassing Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana. Futures Market Interest Propels Analysts to Predict $4,000 ETH Breakout Ethereum‚Äôs open interest dominance has also climbed to nearly 40%, marking its highest point since April 2023. Source: Glassnode This represents a clear transition in speculative focus, with capital flowing from Bitcoin to Ethereum at the margins. Santiment analytics indicate that over the past two weeks, Bitcoin wallets containing at least 1,000 BTC decreased by 1.61%. Conversely, Ethereum wallets holding at least 10,000 ETH increased by 8.00% during the same period. Source: Saintment This enhanced ETH/BTC dominance has enabled the asset to recover from its yearly low of $1,383.26, reaching a 2025 peak of $3,941.86 on July 28. Numerous cryptocurrency traders and expert analysts are now anticipating an ETH price breakthrough above $4,000. gold vs eth if we follow this fractal, we should top around $4k and then a pullback to $3k followed by news highs in Q4 https://t.co/91ZmrrziYF pic.twitter.com/gHi5HzfOs5 ‚Äî Honey (@honey_xbt) July 21, 2025 Altcoin investor ‚ÄúAltcoin Gordon‚Äù shares his bullish sentiment, describing ETH as ‚Äúa beach ball underwater right now.‚Äù He predicts that once ETH breaks $4,000, the rally to $5,000 will be ‚Äúfast and VIOLENT.‚Äù Technical Analysis Points to Ethereum $4,000 Triangle Breakout The monthly chart of Ethereum (ETH/USD) from TradingView shows a significant bullish breakout attempt from a multi-year symmetrical triangle pattern. The price has surged by over 51% in July 2025, closing near $3,766 and approaching a key horizontal resistance zone at $3,859, marked by a previous swing high. The triangle pattern, bounded by a gradually rising support trendline and a descending resistance trendline from the all-time high, has compressed price action since late 2021. ETH is now testing the upper boundary of this structure. A clean breakout above this resistance zone could open the door for higher targets, with Fibonacci extensions indicating possible upside levels around $4,228 (3.618 Fib) and $4,698 (4.236 Fib), with the $3,467 (2.618 Fib) already cleared intramonth. The RSI indicator on the monthly timeframe is reinforcing this bullish setup. After months of sideways action below 50, the RSI has triggered a fresh buy signal by crossing above its moving average and is now sitting at 60.09. This same RSI crossover pattern previously preceded the early 2023 rally. A monthly close above the $3,850‚Äì$4,000 resistance range would confirm the breakout and likely trigger a rally toward the $4,200‚Äì$4,700 area. However, failure to sustain above this range could lead to a retest of the lower trendline near $2,700. For now, momentum and structure f

HEADLINE: BTCC Exchange Reports 35% Trading Volume Growth Following Listing of Over 80 New Spot Trading Pairs in July 2025
SUMMARY: VILNIUS, Lithuania, July 30th, 2025, Chainwire VILNIUS, Lithuania, July 30, 2025 ‚Äì BTCC , the world‚Äôs longest-serving crypto exchange, announced strong growth momentum following its strategic expansion of both spot and futures trading pair offerings. The platform added over 80 new spot pairs in July 2025 alone, bringing the total number of spot pairs to more than 300 and the total number of futures pairs to over 380. This expansion has driven significant growth, with daily average spot trading volume surpassing $4.5 million in the first three weeks of July, representing a remarkable 35% month-over-month increase. The expansion includes popular tokens, including SPX6900 (SPX), Pudgy Penguins (PENGU), Movement (MOVE), Magic Eden (ME), Useless Coin (USELESS), Vine Coin (VINE), Zora (ZORA), reflecting BTCC‚Äôs commitment to providing traders with immediate access to trending cryptocurrencies. These new listings complement the exchange‚Äôs existing strong performers, with MANTA, XRP, BTC, ETH, and SOL leading spot trading volumes. At the same time, XRP, ETH, BTC, SOL, DOGE, and PENGU dominate futures trading activity. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen tremendous momentum as crypto markets recover, which is why we‚Äôve been rapidly expanding our spot listings since Q2 this year,‚Äù said Alex Hung, Head of Operations at BTCC. ‚ÄúOur focus has been on bringing the hottest new tokens to our users quickly to give them access to the trading opportunities they‚Äôre looking for. The spot market is incredibly dynamic, and we‚Äôre making it a key priority in the coming months to drive our continued growth.‚Äù To capitalize on this momentum, BTCC has launched Round 6 of its Hot Coins Trading Week campaign, which highlights trending coins including SPK, PENGU, and PUMP alongside other popular tokens. The campaign offers enhanced trading opportunities and substantial rewards for both new and existing users. The rapid expansion demonstrates BTCC‚Äôs data-driven approach to meeting market demands, with the platform‚Äôs comprehensive offering now spanning major cryptocurrencies, DeFi tokens, and emerging altcoins across both spot and futures markets. About BTCC Founded in 2011, BTCC is a leading global cryptocurrency exchange with the vision to make crypto trading reliable and accessible to everyone. With a strong presence in over 100 countries and regions and a user base of over 9.1 million, BTCC continues to deliver innovation, security, and an unmatched user experience in the cryptocurrency world. Official website: https://www.btcc.com/en-US X: https://x.com/BTCCexchange Contact: press@btcc.com Contact Aaryn Ling press@btcc.com

HEADLINE: Trump Administration Unveils Crypto Strategy But Omits Bitcoin (BTC) Reserve Plan
SUMMARY: The much-anticipated White House report on digital asset markets has finally been released.¬†However, it does not mention a US strategic Bitcoin reserve, an initiative previously proposed by President Donald Trump. Earlier this year, Trump signed an executive order calling for the creation of both a Bitcoin stockpile and a broader digital asset reserve to position the US as a global leader in blockchain finance. Despite this, Wednesday‚Äôs report, issued by the Working Group on Digital Asset Markets, makes no reference to that plan. SEC and CFTC Urged to Act Now The document focuses heavily on regulatory reforms aimed at streamlining crypto market oversight and promoting innovation. Chief among its recommendations is a call for Congress to pass the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act, which would grant the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) authority over spot markets for non-security digital assets. This move is meant to close longstanding regulatory gaps. The report also urges the CFTC and Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to immediately provide more explicit rules on trading, registration, custody, and recordkeeping, using their current powers without waiting for new legislation. The working group said , ‚ÄúBy implementing these recommendations, policymakers can ensure that the United States leads the blockchain revolution and ushers in the Golden Age of Crypto.‚Äù Backs DeFi Innovation, Stablecoin Adoption, Rejects CBDCs Decentralized finance (DeFi) also received a supportive nod. In fact, the group endorsed tools like regulatory sandboxes and safe harbors to help financial products reach consumers faster. Stablecoins took center stage as well, following Trump‚Äôs recent signing of the GENIUS Act. The report urges quick implementation of the law and portrays USD-backed stablecoins as crucial to reinforcing the dollar‚Äôs dominance in digital finance. However, it draws a hard line against central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), which echoed Trump‚Äôs prior support for an ‚ÄúAnti-CBDC Surveillance State Act‚Äù to ban them outright. The group also tackled crypto banking and called for transparency on how institutions can obtain bank charters while simultaneously urging clarification on what crypto activities are permissible for banks. In terms of tax policy, the report recommended treating digital assets as a new class for federal taxation, subject to updated rules on wash sales and alternative minimum tax. It also pressed the Treasury and IRS to revise guidance on crypto-related activities such as mining and staking. The post Trump Administration Unveils Crypto Strategy But Omits Bitcoin (BTC) Reserve Plan appeared first on CryptoPotato .
text: Trump Administration Unveils Crypto Strategy But Omits Bitcoin (BTC) Reserve Plan. The much-anticipated White House report on digital asset markets has finally been released.¬†However, it does not mention a US strategic Bitcoin reserve, an initiative previously proposed by President Donald Trump. Earlier this year, Trump signed an executive order calling for the creation of both a Bitcoin stockpile and a broader digital asset reserve to position the US as a global leader in blockchain finance. Despite this, Wednesday‚Äôs report, issued by the Working Group on Digital Asset Markets, makes no reference to that plan. SEC and CFTC Urged to Act Now The document focuses heavily on regulatory reforms aimed at streamlining crypto market oversight and promoting innovation. Chief among its recommendations is a call for Congress to pass the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act, which would grant the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) authority over spot markets for non-security digital assets. This move is meant to close longstanding regulatory gaps. The report also urges the CFTC and Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to immediately provide more explicit rules on trading, registration, custody, and recordkeeping, using their current powers without waiting for new legislation. The working group said , ‚ÄúBy implementing these recommendations, policymakers can ensure that the United States leads the blockchain revolution and ushers in the Golden Age of Crypto.‚Äù Backs DeFi Innovation, Stablecoin Adoption, Rejects CBDCs Decentralized finance (DeFi) also received a supportive nod. In fact, the group endorsed tools like regulatory sandboxes and safe harbors to help financial products reach consumers faster. Stablecoins took center stage as well, following Trump‚Äôs recent signing of the GENIUS Act. The report urges quick implementation of the law and portrays USD-backed stablecoins as crucial to reinforcing the dollar‚Äôs dominance in digital finance. However, it draws a hard line against central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), which echoed Trump‚Äôs prior support for an ‚ÄúAnti-CBDC Surveillance State Act‚Äù to ban them outright. The group also tackled crypto banking and called for transparency on how institutions can obtain bank charters while simultaneously urging clarification on what crypto activities are permissible for banks. In terms of tax policy, the report recommended treating digital assets as a new class for federal taxation, subject to updated rules on wash sales and alternative minimum tax. It also pressed the Treasury and IRS to revise guidance on crypto-related activities such as mining and staking. HEADLINE: London-Based Web Design Firm The Smarter Web Company Announces It Acquired Bitcoin! Here''s the Total BTC It Holds!
SUMMARY: London-based web design firm The Smarter Web Company has achieved remarkable success by surpassing the 2,000 BTC threshold following its transition to a Bitcoin-focused treasury strategy. British Web Design Company The Smarter Web Company Surpasses 2,000 BTC Treasury The company announced today that it has purchased an additional 225 BTC. The purchase was made for a total of ¬£19.91 million (approximately $26.57 million) at an average price of ¬£88,482 ($118,080) per unit. This new acquisition follows the company''s announced ¬£19.7 million fundraising, which involved the issuance of 6,057,914 new shares at a price of approximately ¬£3.25 per share. The Smarter Web Company currently holds a total of 2,050 BTC. These Bitcoins were purchased at an average cost of ¬£81,346 ($108,556), bringing the total spend to ¬£166.76 million ($222.54 million). With this size, the company became the largest institutional Bitcoin holder in the UK and among the top 25 public Bitcoin treasuries globally. The company''s CEO, Andrew Webley, stated that they purchased more than 1,500 BTC in July alone and aim to quickly become one of the top 20 treasury holders. Currently trading at $118,085, the company is reportedly making a profit of $19.53 million, a gain of approximately 8.8% on paper. The company, which has been accepting payments with Bitcoin since 2023, announced in April that it would shape future growth in this direction by adopting a Bitcoin treasury policy. After the company began trading on the Aquis Exchange on April 25 under the symbol SWC, its shares quickly surged 20,000% to ¬£605 after the announcement of its treasury strategy, before falling 70% to ¬£192.66. The stock is currently trading flat at ¬£208.45. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: London-Based Web Design Firm The Smarter Web Company Announces It Acquired Bitcoin! Here''s the Total BTC It Holds!
